title: docker build fails with error: No module named spacy
body:
**Describe the bug**
Docker build fails on command `python -m spacy download en ` with error
```
/usr/local/bin/python: No module named spacy
```

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to ludwig root directory
2. run command: `docker build  -t ludwig .`

Please provide code, yaml definition file and a sample of data in order to entirely reproduce the issue.
Issues that are not reproducible will be ignored.

**Expected behavior**
Successful build of ludwig docker image

**Screenshots**
relevant portion of docker build log:
```
Jim-MacBook-Pro:jim ludwig_sandbox[505]$ bash build_ludwig_image.bash
[+] Building 63.9s (6/7)
 => [internal] load build definition from Dockerfile                                                                                   0.0s
 => => transferring dockerfile: 37B                                                                                                    0.0s
 => [internal] load .dockerignore                                                                                                      0.0s
 => => transferring context: 2B                                                                                                        0.0s
 => [internal] load metadata for docker.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3                                                            0.6s
 => [1/4] FROM docker.io/tensorflow/tensorflow:latest-py3@sha256:0b236338fac6c3361cf3ae1448f8c053994e260c1edc4fa63ed80adb3045abb2      0.0s
 => CACHED [2/4] RUN apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends         git libgmp3-dev                                                0.0s
 => ERROR [3/4] RUN git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/uber/ludwig.git     && cd ludwig/     && pip install -r requirements.txt   63.2s
------
 > [3/4] RUN git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/uber/ludwig.git     && cd ludwig/     && pip install -r requirements.txt     && python -m spacy download en     && python setup.py install:
#6 0.508 Cloning into 'ludwig'...
#6 2.592 Collecting Cython>=0.25 (from -r requirements.txt (line 1))
#6 3.126   Downloading https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/45/f2/a7101b3457561e57f5abcd6f5ac13190054fecd7370f58f36fe2d6574742/Cython-0.29.13-cp36-cp36m-manylinux1_x86_64.whl (2.1MB)
#6 3.760 Requirement already satisfied: h5py>=2.6 in /usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages (from -r requirements.txt (line 2)) (2.10.0)
<<<<<<<<< removed non-relevant messages>>>>>>>>>>>>
#6 62.13 Successfully installed Cython-0.29.13 PyYAML-5.1.2 joblib-0.14.0 pandas-0.25.2 python-dateutil-2.8.0 pytz-2019.3 scikit-learn-0.21.3 scipy-1.3.1 tabulate-0.8.5 tensorboard-1.14.0 tensorflow-1.14.0 tensorflow-estimator-1.14.0 tqdm-4.36.1
#6 62.88 WARNING: You are using pip version 19.2.3, however version 19.3.1 is available.
#6 62.88 You should consider upgrading via the 'pip install --upgrade pip' command.
#6 62.96 /usr/local/bin/python: No module named spacy
------
failed to solve with frontend dockerfile.v0: failed to build LLB: executor failed running [/bin/sh -c git clone --depth=1 https://github.com/uber/ludwig.git     && cd ludwig/     && pip install -r requirements.txt     && python -m spacy download en     && python setup.py install]: exit code: 1
```

**Environment (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: MacOS
 - Version 10.15
- Python 3.6
- Ludwig version:  master branch at commit sha1: c69ac875
- Docker for Mac: 2.1.0.3

**Additional context**
From what I can tell, this error is caused by the recent PR #529 that moved the `spacy` requirement from `requirements.txt` to `requirements_text.txt`.  

In my testing, updating this Dockerfile build instruction from
```
&& pip install -r requirements.txt \
```
to
```
&& pip install -r requirements.txt -r requirements_text.txt\
```
fixes the issue. 

 I'll submit a PR for this change.
